instruction: Given some comments, label each of them as positive or negative.
input:
* Amazing product!
* Unsatisfactory service, will never come back
output:
Positive
Negative

instruction: Rearrange the following sentence such that it scans in iambic pentameter.
input: She trekked across the rugged terrain
output: Across she trekked the rugged ter-rain.

instruction: Write a poem about drug addictions.
output:
Twas late one night, his tears were cold
No escape, addiction did hold
The dark room silent yet deep
Leading deeper with every step

A demon lingered in his brain
One to leave him drained and lame
No matter what he did try
The need to use wouldn't die

Despair filled his aching heart
Pain it causes him to start
Pleading for someone to hear
Dreams corrupted by despair

No way out of this cruel curse
Addiction ensnares him so worse
Will he be able to escape
This dreaded drug's deadly embrace?

instruction: Given a set of facts, make a statistic report.
input: 60% of people surveyed have watched a movie in the last week.
output: According to a recent survey, 60% of people reported having watched a movie in the last week.

instruction: Compare and contrast two news articles about the same event.
input:
Article 1: The police made multiple arrests after a fight between two football teams erupted.
Article 2: A confrontation between two football players led to a clash between the team members.
output: Both articles discuss a fight that erupted between two football teams. In Article 1, the police made multiple arrests, implying that the incident was serious enough to require legal attention. In Article 2, the source focuses on the initial confrontation between two football players, emphasizing that the conflict started at the individual level.

instruction: Propose a solution to eliminate cheating in schools.
output: Schools should implement an honor code policy that outlines expected academic standards and procedures. All students should sign the code, which should address all forms of cheating, plagiarism and collusion, and also provide clear consequences. In addition, schools could also utilize advanced technologies to help detect plagiarism and cheating. Random checks of student work may also be introduced, along with anonymous reporting measures for students who want to report cheating.

instruction: What is the maximum altitude a hot air balloon can reach?
output: The maximum altitude for a hot air balloon is typically about 25,000 feet above sea level, although some have even flown higher. The record for the highest altitude achieved by a hot air balloon is 40,000 feet.

instruction: What is the most natural satellite of Earth?
output: The most natural satellite of Earth is the Moon.

instruction: What is the naming convention for elements in the Periodic Table?
output: The elements in the Periodic Table are named according to the atomic structure of each element. They are named according to the number of protons they contain. Generally speaking, if an element has one or a two-letter symbol, the element will be named using its atomic number (the number of protons it contains). If the element has a three-letter symbol, it will be named using the element's common or trivial name.

instruction: Learn a new word and give a definition
output: My new word is "telescopic", which means having the capacity to select or view details in far away objects. It can be used to describe the ability of someone to observe a distant object with parts being magnified individually.

instruction: What types of trivia can you think of?
output: I can think of trivia questions related to history, geography, science, sports, entertainment, literature, and pop culture. You could also come up with trivia questions related to current events, statistics, and other facts.

instruction: What are the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World?
output: The Seven Wonders of the Ancient World are the Great Pyramid of Giza (Egypt), the Hanging Gardens of Babylon (Iraq), the Statue of Zeus at Olympia (Greece), the Temple of Artemis at Ephesus (Turkey), the Mausoleum at Halicarnassus (Turkey), the Colossus of Rhodes (Greece), and the Lighthouse of Alexandria (Egypt).

instruction: Edit the following text by reorganizing the sentences.
input: I am relaxed tonight. A warm bath helps me relax. I enjoy the quiet.
output: I enjoy the quiet tonight, and to help me relax, I took a warm bath.

instruction: Tell me three interesting facts about Mars.
output: Three interesting facts about Mars are: it has the tallest mountain in the solar system called Olympus Mons; it has a rare type of soil called regolith which is made up of fine particles of rock and dust; and it has the most extreme temperature ranges of any planet in the solar system, ranging from -225 degrees Celsius to 20 degrees Celsius.

instruction: Generate a list of five unique project ideas.
output:
1. Creating an interactive game that simulates the experience of living on Mars. 
2. Developing an application that tracks and alerts users to local environmental issues and encourages environmental stewardship. 
3. Building a neighborhood-level weather monitoring system to improve accuracy and understanding of local conditions. 
4. Developing an algorithm that can generate a personalized podcast playlists based on user-defined interests. 
5. Designing a charitable donation platform with a mechanism to transparently document how funds are used.

instruction: Classify the following sample as either plagiarism or not plagiarism.
input:
The teacher said that students should write their essay in a creative way.

I wrote my essay in an interesting way.
output: Not plagiarism.

instruction: Generate a list of five legal rights that citizens of a country have.
output:
1. The right to vote 
2. The right to a fair trial 
3. The right to freedom of speech and expression 
4. The right to access information 
5. The right to privacy

instruction: Create a unified style guideline for your company
output:
Company Style Guidelines

We want all of our communications to look and sound unified, so PXCorp has established the following standards.

* Our logo should always be present and prominently displayed on all communications.
* Our brand colors - black, blue, and white - should be used as the basis of all design choices and color palettes.
* Fonts should remain consistent throughout all communications. The primary font is Avenir and the secondary font is Helvetica.
* All written documents should be composed clearly and concisely.
* Images should be of high quality and reflect the companyâ€™s core values.
* All communications should be respectful and professional.

instruction: Categorize each of the items according to their type
output:
Pen: Writing Tool 
Pencil: Writing Tool 
Scissors: Cutting Tool 
Hammer: Building/Construction Tool

instruction: Generate a romantic message for a couple
output: To the sweetest couple ever, I hope that your love story never ends. May all your moments together be filled with smiles, laughter, and endless amounts of joy. Whenever you share your love, may it be returned twofold. I wish you both a lifetime of happiness.

instruction: Given the string "hello, how are you?", Remove the punctuation
output: "hello how are you"

instruction: What type of tree did George Washington famously cut down?
output: George Washington infamously cut down a Cherry Tree.

instruction: A friend of yours is considering taking a gap year before college. Write a short paragraph in which you encourage them to take the gap year.
output: Taking a gap year before college can be an excellent decision, as it can help to provide clarity and focus when starting your higher education journey. During a gap year, you can take the time to explore yourself and the world around you in new ways, as well as gain new skills and experiences that can be invaluable when starting college. Whether you are looking to go travel, volunteer your time, or begin a job to start amassing your own funds, a gap year can help to provide you with the opportunity for self-discovery that may not be there later on. So, if you have the chance, make sure to consider the idea of taking a gap year before college.

instruction: Write an email to a customer with an apology.
input:
Dear [Name],
I apologize for the inconvenience caused.
output:
Dear [Name], 
I am sorry for the inconvenience caused due to the issue you faced when trying to use our service. We understand how important it is for you to get the expected results as quickly as possible and we deeply apologize for not meeting your expectations. 

To make it right, we offer you [offer]. Please don't hesitate to contact us if you need any further assistance. 

Sincerely, 
[Your name]

instruction: Generate a story about a character who is frustrated about their job.
output:
John was frustrated with his job. He had worked at the same desk for eight years now and he was tired of the monotony. Every day was the same: waking up, going to work, and coming home again to do it all over again. He had no way to find purpose in his work, and couldn't find a way to challenge himself to make it more interesting.

One day, John decided he had had enough. That afternoon, he quit his job without giving a notice. He wanted to use the time he had to find something meaningful in his life, something that he could be proud of and that would give him a sense of satisfaction.

With this newfound freedom, John began to explore the world around him. He discovered a passion for cooking and soon began to pursue it as a career. Through hard work and dedication, he soon began to make a living out of it and was able to find something meaningful to pour himself into. He was now able to wake up every morning and commit himself to something he was passionate about.

John had finally found his true passion in life and was much happier than he had been in a long time. He was no longer frustrated and bored with his life, but instead he had found something new and exciting to look forward to each day.
